clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Trial in knEe Osteoarthritis Using Low Intensity Ultrasound - Evaluating Feasibility (RELIEF)
clinical_study.official_title: Can Very Low Intensity Ultrasound Therapy Improve Pain in People With Knee Osteoarthritis? A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this pilot study is to determine the feasibility of conducting a high quality clinical trial to investigate the effects of low intensity, pulsed ultrasound on knee osteoarthritis pain and physical function.

clinical_study.why_stopped: funding to support alternate feasible recruitment strategy was not acquired

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Ability to recruit 30 participants over a 6 month period
Percent adherence to the protocols for randomization, recruitment, intervention, and assessment
Number of participants completing the trial

Participants will be asked about serious and non-serious adverse events weekly during the 13 week intervention phase and monthly during the 13 week follow up phase. All adverse events will be recorded and addressed as indicated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Western Ontario and McMaster Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC)3.1NPR pain subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in pain at 13 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Western Ontario and McMaster Osteoarthritis Index (WOMAC)3.1NPR physical function subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Physical Function at 26 weeks
Change from baseline distance (metres) walked in 6 minutes at 26 weeks
Change from baseline in Health Related Quality of Life at 26 weeks

Change from baseline in Global Rating of Disease Severity at 13 and 26 weeks will be assessed using an 11-point scale ('Considering all the ways that your knee arthritis affects you, please rate how you are doing on a scale from 0 (very well) to 10 (very poor))
Change from baseline in pain intensity (average, minimum and maximum over the past 24 hours and following physical performance tests)
Change from baseline in physical function at 26 weeks
Time (seconds) to ascend and descend a staircase with 9 steps

Perceived change from baseline will be assessed at 13 and 26 weeks using an 11-point scale ('With respect to your OA knee treated with ultrasound, how would you describe yourself now compared to baseline assessment?' -5 = a very great deal worse, 0 = about the same, +5 = a very great deal better)

intervention.description: 1.5MHz, spatial average-temporal average intensity = 0.03W/cm2, pulsed (burst frequency 1kHz, burst duration 200µm, duty cycle 20%); self-administered to the medial side of the knee joint while sitting down for 20 minutes every day for 3 months.
intervention.other_name: Exogen Express Ultrasound Bone Healing System

intervention.description: no ultrasonic energy emitted; self-administered to the medial side of the knee joint while sitting down for 20 minutes every day for 3 months
intervention.other_name: sham Exogen Express Ultrasound Bone Healing System
